org.wise.portal.presentation.web.controllers.forgotaccount.student

Class PasswordReminderWizardController

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.wise.portal.presentation.web.controllers.forgotaccount.student.PasswordReminderWizardController

  • @Controller
 @RequestMapping(value="/forgotaccount/student/passwordreminder")
 @SessionAttributes(value="passwordReminderParameters")
public class PasswordReminderWizardController
extends Object
    Controller for the wizard to "Remind the student of their password" The default getTargetPage() method is used to find out which page to navigate to, so the controller looks for a request parameter starting with "_target" and ending with a number (e.g. "_target1"). The jsp pages should provide these parameters. General method invocation flow (when user clicks on "prev" and "next"): 1) onBind 2) onBindAndValidate 3) validatePage 4) referenceData Note that on user's first visit to the first page of the wizard, only referenceData will be invoked, and steps 1-4 are bypassed.
    Author:
    Anthony Perritano

      Maybe you want to be provided with the _page parameter (in order to map the same method for all), as you have in AbstractWizardFormController.
